intro: Lessingia virgata var. glomerata, commonly known as the clustered lessingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Cariophyllaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are clustered in racemes, which contribute to its ornamental value. This variety is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes.
